isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - OPERATION - POWER DIVIDER LOCK (PDL) WARNING LIGHT AND BUZZER

svcproc.title: POWER DIVIDER LOCK (PDL) WARNING LIGHT AND BUZZER

svcprocinfo.para: When the power divider lockout switch is engaged, the normally open switch is closed, completing the ground path for the warning light, turning the light ON.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The PDL warning light is located in the right gauge cluster. The light receives 12V ignition power (key ON) from 10A fuse F4-A through cluster connector (420) circuit 28C. The ground path for the light from cluster connector (420) is circuit 43 (or 43A with optional alarm) to the PDL switch. The switch is grounded through circuits 43-G/11-GB at the right dash panel ground stud.

svcsubproc.title: Alarm (562)
svcsubproc.para: The optional alarm, located in the power distribution center, receives ignition power (key ON) from ignition adapter (494) on circuit 13X. The alarm is grounded through the PDL switch. With the switch closed, the alarm sounds.
